title: In-Database Analytics in MarkLogic
abstract: Enterprises are increasingly achieving competitive advantage through analytics on the structured and unstructured data they collect. In this session, we'll survey the array of analytic options available to MarkLogic users today, then take a sneak peek at some features in the works for a future release of MarkLogic Server. Find out how MarkLogic adds to your Big Data toolkit with advanced in-memory indexes and APIs, and how you can apply algorithms close to the data and in parallel for greater efficiency.

surveys.comments:
From a relational model background, ml analytics are behind-however the information provided was good.
Should register udf's on each d-node and leave them there, providing a catalog of available udf's / installed udf's.

First half of session didn't match second half. The first half was pretty basic while the second half was very technical. That's fine, but it leaves most people in audience bored for half the session.
